description.definition: To ask someone to join an event; a request for someone's presence.

description.definition: Third person singular of 'to be.'
description.example: She is happy.

I.phrase: We visited an [island] on our trip.

description.definition: A piece of land surrounded by water.
description.example: They live on a small island.

description.definition: A pronoun used for objects or animals; refers to something previously mentioned.
description.example: It is cold outside.

description.definition: Possessive form of 'it.'
description.example: The cat licked its paws.

description.definition: The brother of one's parent.
description.example: I have an uncle who lives in Canada.

description.definition: In a position lower than something.
description.example: She hid under the bed.

description.definition: To grasp the meaning of something.
description.example: Do you understand the instructions?

description.definition: A single thing that is part of a larger whole.
description.example: We measured the distance in metric units.

U.phrase: We will wait [until] it stops raining.

description.definition: Up to the time that.
description.simplified: Up to a point in time.
description.example: I will stay here until you come.

description.definition: Toward a higher place.

description.definition: To employ for a purpose; the act of using something.

description.definition: Able to be used for a practical purpose.
description.example: Learning new skills is useful.

description.definition: Commonly encountered; normal.

description.definition: In the way that is common or expected.

description.definition: The female ruler of a country or a woman of high rank.

description.definition: A sentence or phrase used to find out information.
description.simplified: Something you ask to get information.

description.definition: Done with speed.
description.example: She gave a quick response.

description.definition: Making little or no noise.

description.definition: To a certain extent; fairly.

V.phrase: I eat a [vegetable] with every meal.

description.definition: A plant or part of a plant used as food.
description.simplified: A type of food from plants.
description.example: Carrots and spinach are healthy vegetables.

V.phrase: She was [very] happy with her gift.

description.definition: Used for emphasis.
description.example: He is very tall.

description.definition: A small community or group of houses in a rural area.

description.definition: The sound produced by humans or animals when speaking or singing.

V.phrase: We plan to [visit] our grandparents this weekend.

description.definition: To go and see someone or someplace.

Y.phrase: This [year] has been full of surprises.

description.definition: A period of 365 days, or 12 months, starting from January 1.

description.definition: Used to express affirmation or agreement.

Y.phrase: I saw her [yesterday] at the park.

description.definition: On the day before today.
description.example: Yesterday was a sunny day.

description.definition: Up to the present time; until now.
description.example: Are you ready yet?

description.definition: Used to refer to the person or people being addressed.
description.example: You are very kind.

Y.phrase: She is a [young] artist with great talent.

description.definition: Having lived or existed for only a short time.
description.example: He has a young dog.

description.definition: Belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
description.example: Your shoes are by the door.

description.definition: The numerical symbol representing the absence of quantity; it is the integer that precedes one.
description.example: Zero is neither positive nor negative.

Z.phrase: The school is located in a quiet [zone]

description.definition: An area or region distinguished from others by particular characteristics or uses.
